results.title: The Little world of Dietmar Fill
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The late Dietmar Fill has been accorded many honours for his remarkable natural science films and his micro-photography. This series draws together the best of his work, giving us an insight into his film-making techniques and letting us meet the man.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Estuary
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Features the plants (mangroves) and animals living in a tidal estuary at Port Stevens, Sydney. Discusses the habitat problems of tidal movement and salinity in fresh water. Narrated by Robin Williams.

results.title: Shore
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Where the sea meets the land we find a place of harsh extremes and constant change. Dietmar, Bibi and marine biologist Elizabeth Pope, explore the rich and varied life of the rocky seashore. Narrated by Robyn Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Coral reef
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
This video takes us to Herron Island, describes the wildlife and then concentrates on the smaller prcesses of reef builders. This program takes a while to get started. The coral photography is very good.

results.title: Weedy plot
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
One of a series of films which is designed to help bring about a better understanding of how our legal processes work in solving the everyday human conflicts and disputes. This is a case about an employee fired for rudeness. Cast includes Don Pasere, Wendy Playfair, Les Foxcraft, Ken Goodlet.

results.title: The Good oil
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A funny, true to life story about a group of residents and their conflict with a nearby factory management. The residents’ indignation over sleepless nights and spoiled washing has its funny moments but the way is opened for serious questions about our changing environment

results.title: Buying blues
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A young girl takes a clothing retailer to the Consumer Claims Tribunal claiming that her newly purchased jeans were falsely represented. The complainant, the trader and their witnesses give different versions of what happened at the point of sale. The referee has to decide where the truth lies. Based on a true story. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Accident
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A serious accident brings a tragic end to the dreams and ambitions of a young migrant worker. Looks at the rights of workers and the responsibility of management in industrial accidents. Opens up for consideration the alternatives of Workers Compensation or suing under judge made law.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia

results.title: Working agreement
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
Shows how an industrial award comes into being, tracing the progress of a new log of claims by workers as it moves from negotiations between unions and employers thorugh to the Conciliation and Arbitration Commission. Cast includes Henri Szeps, Gordon Piper, Maggie Kirkpatrick. Suitable for upper secondary level.
